item.title: French police may nab Louvre thieves but unlikely to recover their loot
item.description:
By Gabriel Stargardter, Juliette Jabkhiro and Elissa Darwish

PARIS (Reuters) -Crime gangs around Europe are increasingly robbing valuable jewels and gold from cash-needy museums like the Louvre, but while law enforcement often catches the thieves, they struggle to recover the priceless goods, police and art experts say.

Only a small pool of criminals would be capable of such a job as Sunday's audacious robbery in Paris and may already be known to police, the specialists say. But the objects themselves could be quickly broken down into component parts and sold on.

item.title: Former Israeli hostage 'looking ahead', determined to move on
item.description:
After more than a year trapped in a dark tunnel under Gaza, Eli Sharabi is determined to move forward with his life, even as he knows that pain and grief will be constant companions.

"It's impossible to forget even a single moment of my captivity," the 53-year-old Israeli former hostage told AFP in an interview on Monday.

"But it does not define who I am."

Sharabi was abducted from his home in Kibbutz Beeri during the unprecedented Hamas attack on southern Israel on October 7, 2023.

That day, he lost almost everything.

item.title: Russia, Iran to boost ties in ‘all areas’ as Tehran claims nuclear restrictions expired
item.description: <!-- THEME DEBUG --> <!-- THEME HOOK: 'views_view_field' --> <!-- BEGIN OUTPUT from 'core/themes/stable9/templates/views/views-view-field.html.twig' --> The cooperation pledges follow the weekend's joint letter from Russia, Iran and China to the UN, disputing the validity of reimposing sanctions on Iran. <!-- END OUTPUT from 'core/themes/stable9/templates/views/views-view-field.html.twig' -->

item.title: Bahrain joins Gulf’s late movers in the solar race with 150 MW project
item.description: <!-- THEME DEBUG --> <!-- THEME HOOK: 'views_view_field' --> <!-- BEGIN OUTPUT from 'core/themes/stable9/templates/views/views-view-field.html.twig' --> If completed on schedule, the Bilaj Al Jazayer solar plant would more than double the kingdom’s total installed renewable capacity, which stood at just 69 MW in 2024. <!-- END OUTPUT from 'core/themes/stable9/templates/views/views-view-field.html.twig' -->

item.title: Iran says cooperation deal with UN nuclear watchdog is void
item.description:
DUBAI (Reuters) -Iran has scrapped a cooperation deal that it signed with the UN nuclear watchdog IAEA in September, its Supreme National Security Council Secretary said on Monday, according to state media.

The statement came around three weeks after Iran's foreign minister, Abbas Araqchi, said Tehran would scrap the agreement, which let the IAEA resume inspections of its nuclear sites, if Western powers reinstated U.N. sanctions.

Those were reinstated last month.

item.title: Syria finance chief meets US, World Bank officials as Trump admin pushes more sanction relief
item.description: <!-- THEME DEBUG --> <!-- THEME HOOK: 'views_view_field' --> <!-- BEGIN OUTPUT from 'core/themes/stable9/templates/views/views-view-field.html.twig' --> Less than two weeks ago, the US Senate approved a measure to repeal the 2019 Caesar Syria Civilian Protection Act sanctions on Syria as part of its 2026 defense budget. <!-- END OUTPUT from 'core/themes/stable9/templates/views/views-view-field.html.twig' -->

item.title: Witkoff, Kushner in Israel to salvage Gaza ceasefire after series of flareups
item.description: <!-- THEME DEBUG --> <!-- THEME HOOK: 'views_view_field' --> <!-- BEGIN OUTPUT from 'core/themes/stable9/templates/views/views-view-field.html.twig' --> The Trump administration is stepping up pressure on Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to maintain the ceasefire with Hamas and begin implementing the second phase of the US president's Gaza peace plan. <!-- END OUTPUT from 'core/themes/stable9/templates/views/views-view-field.html.twig' -->
